answers.answer: Have you considered a different doctor? I mean if your doctor can't answer, or won't answer, your questions, then you might find one that will. I don't know if it has anything to do with diabetes since I'm not diabetic, but I do have lower back pain. Mine, after an MRI, was diagnosed at first as buldging discs for which I took steroids, then a lumbar epidural. Next MRI showed ruptured discs w/bone fragments pressing nerves. This led to surgery. Still not pain free but better. Seriously consider seeing another doctor.

question: Every morning i wake up with this terrible lower back pain and it hurts real bad i can barely walk or bend, the pain goes away after a couple of hours not all the way but is not as bad as when i wake up, is this normal since im a diabetic?I ask my doctor and she does not tell me anything about it.
title: lower back
